flashcards.english: 1st Person: Nĩĩ (I/me) → Njĩtagwo (my name is), Ĩthũĩ (we) → Twĩtagwo (we are called). 2nd Person: Wee (you-sing) → Wĩtagwo (your name is), Ĩnyuĩ (you-plur) → Mwĩtagwo (you are called). 3rd Person: We (he/she) → Etagwo (his/her name is), O (they) → Metagwo (they are called). Question pattern: Nĩ nĩũ ũ? (who am I?), Wee nĩ wee ũ? (who are you?), We nĩ we ũ? (who is he/she?)
flashcards.notes: Complete pronoun system (week 3-1) showing name-giving patterns. Pattern: pronoun + nĩ + pronoun + interrogative for questions. Naming: Njĩtagwo/Twĩtagwo/Wĩtagwo/Mwĩtagwo/Etagwo/Metagwo. Examples: Nĩ ĩthũĩ agenĩ (we are visitors), Nĩ o ambunge (they are legislators)
